subject: Marketing
title: The Birth of the Ad Agency
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Birth of the Ad Agency.

hook.text: In 1841, Volney Palmer opened the first advertising agency in Philadelphia.

buildup.text: Early agencies simply bought newspaper space in bulk and resold it to businesses.

discovery.text: Over time, agencies started writing the ads tooâ€”creating an entirely new profession.

twist.text: The agency model turned advertising from a merchant's chore into a specialized craft.

climax.text: By 1900, agencies employed artists, writers, and psychologists working together on campaigns.

punchline.text: One person bought space. An industry was born.

quiz.question: What did the first advertising agencies originally do?
options: Bought newspaper space in bulk and resold it to businesses
Produced television commercials for major brands
Managed social media accounts for companies
